channel.title: Saving Progress
channel.description:
We kept adding new fields to rscd_players for quest variables until we have like 70+ columns.
For our new base we've considered other options, such as keeping the bare essentials in the database that the website needs to access and then insert the serialized Java object into a BLOB that's stored in MySQL. This way if a new quest is added we don't have to worry about SQL columns either.
[code="Java"]int x = <int>player.getCache().getVariable("variableName");[/code]
[code="Java"]Quest quest = player.getQuest("The Knight's Sword"); quest.variable = 4;[/code]
Any other ideas?

item.title: Saving Progress
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:3, topic:421034”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=523709.msg3809968#msg3809968 date=1320805403]
Graph database.

There are other NoSQL options that would work, but I think a graph database would be better.
[/quote]
I’ve never heard of that before. Could you explain what it is please?[/quote]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_database

Neo4j Graph Database Platform

The Neo4j Graph Platform – The #1 Platform for Connected Data

Meet Neo4j: The graph database platform powering today's mission-critical enterprise applications, including artificial intelligence, fraud detection and recommendations.
